intro: Stylypus, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking, orange-yellow, tubular flowers. The plant produces long, pendulous inflorescences that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Stylypus typically grows as a climbing vine, featuring heart-shaped leaves and woody stems. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
